channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours

[+2335] How would millions of tiny dead fish look? BP helps answer
[+2327] Time Spent In Shower (Pie Chart)
[+2049] 10 Things Android Does Better Than iPhone OS
item.description: When Android first debuted on the HTC Dream (also known as the G1) back in October of 2008, it was deemed an "iPhone Killer." While it didn't quite slay Apple's handset, it was the first step in a revolution against the tyrannous iPhone.

item.title: [+1776] Why Nashville Had No Looters During the Floods
[+1732] Coffee Lovers [Pic]
[+1542] Valve's E3 surprise
[+1493] TV University [Faculty Rosters]
[+1270] What Does a Video Look Like After 1000 YouTube Uploads?
item.description: What Does a Video Look Like After 1000 YouTube Uploads? Musician Patrick Liddell recorded a video of himself giving a short monologue and uploaded it to YouTube. He then downloaded the file from YouTube, and uploaded that file - repeating the process 1000 times. It got pretty weird.

item.title: [+1214] Finally, Some Actual Stats on Internet Porn
item.description: Everyone "knows" how big internet porn is, when compared to industries like TV, movies and everything else. But how big is it really?

item.title: [+1081] MIT Science Fiction Society's review of Twilight
[+1019] Should We Nuke The Oil Leak?
item.description: Back in the day, the Soviets managed to seal off five different oil leaks with the "nuclear option

item.title: [+1008] E-mailing AT&T CEO will result in a cease and desist letter
item.description: Sure, Steve Jobs might be a one-man email PR machine, but his pal Randall Stephenson at AT&T doesn't appear to be quite as gregarious -- as reader Giorgio Galante found out today, sending AT&T's CEO two emails in two weeks results in a phone call from AT&T Executive Response Team and a warning that further emails will result in a cease and desist.

item.title: [+966] Note to BP: What NOT to say when you're ruining the world
item.description: NEWSWEEK: BP CEO Tony Hayward has made gaffe after gaffe defending his company's response to the gulf oil spill. Here are some of his many unfortunate remarks.

item.title: [+743] If Movies Followed Their Original Casting (Pics)
item.description: Many popular films’ original cast did not include some of the actors and actresses well known for that role in the film today. Here are what movie posters would look like if they followed their original casting.

item.title: [+717] Steve Jobs says Gizmodo tried to extort Apple
item.description: For the first time since Gizmodo uncovered the iPhone 4G, Apple CEO Steve Jobs publicly discussed his thoughts on the mater during a recent interview at the D8 conference.

item.title: [+693] "Canadian DMCA" legalizes CD ripping, mashups, backups
item.description: Canada's major new copyright reform legislation would legalize DVRs, CD ripping, backup copies, parodies, and mashups. But it comes with a poison pill: tough DRM anti-circumvention rules. Digital locks again trump fair dealing.

item.title: [+675] A Day In The Life Of A Coder [Comic]
[+668] Children Of All Ages Delighted By Enslavement Of Elephant
item.description: Cheers, laughter, and applause filled the big top tent at the Ringling Bros. Circus Saturday as children of all ages were captivated by the savage enslavement of Topsy the elephant.
